story.kicker_image_caption: A high-power delegation of the French government and railway officials inspected the New Delhi railway station on Thursday.
story.storykicker: Decongestion, cleanliness, passenger amenities are our primary concerns, says Arun Arora
story.storybody:
The French National Railways has agreed to co-finance an execution study, which will be the first step towards the semi-high speed train project on the Delhi-Chandigarh route. The 27-member delegation was briefed about the intense passenger service and train operation in Delhi.

혖Re-development of New Delhi station

The delegation minutely inspected the railway station. French railways has also agreed to develop the railway stations at Ambala and Ludhiana on the Delhi.Chandigarh.Amritsar route. They have been briefed about the crowd situation and also the commercial constraints. The French government has to take a call on redeveloping the New Delhi station.

Constraints at New Delhi

Built in 1926, the station was modernised in 2010, before the Commonwealth Games. However, the passenger footfall at the station is increasing constantly. With no space on Paharganj and Ajmeri Gate sides, the station can be developed vertically, which will be a viable option commercially.

혖Passenger amenities at railway stations in Delhi

Decongestion, cleanliness, passenger amenities are our primary concerns. During 혖eHumsafar week혖f, we initiated 24 programmes related to passenger amenities.

Also read: Indian Railways, Power Ministry aim to achieve 100 per cent electrification of rail network

briefcase_content.briefcase: Indian Railways has signed MoUs with railways across 14 countries.
France will share its expertise in special fields.
